meanings.definition: Capable of being set on fire or burned with a torch.
meanings.sent1: The dry leaves were torchable and caught fire quickly.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden house was torchable and burned down in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The torchable paper lantern accidentally lit up the entire room!
meanings.sent4: His temper was like a torchable fuse, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The torchable fabric glowed brightly as it burned.

meanings.definition: Able to be easily ignited or destroyed by a torch.
meanings.sent1: The oily rags were torchable and posed a fire hazard.
meanings.sent2: The fragile curtains were torchable and needed to be handled with care.
meanings.sent3: The torchable ice sculpture melted instantly under the heat of the torch!
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were torchable, easily shattered by harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The torchable material burst into flames with a single spark.
